message.body: you have any info on how apple exploits its employees/customers/environment?
Exploits? No.
I've heard rumors of their not-so-great corporate culture, and they obviously don't give a shit about their customers outside of them buying stuff (from my perspective).
Well
There was all that stuff happening in China
but moreso than any other company?
I think a few factory workers killed themselves for some reason in connection to the company, though Apple did kind of shrug that off.
No, it's a normal company, albeit I've heard Steve Jobs is a neurotic asshat
but again, these are factory workers in china, employed by vendors, not apple itself
Sure
I not saying its right, but its business as usual today
Right
that's really one of the reasons I like Google -- they have their share of fuck-ups, but overall I get the impression that they're trying to innovate for my sake, not to, foremost, to make money
well Im pretty sure you're wrong
I'm not saying they're doing it out of the kindness of their hearts.
Or even that the corporation itself has that mindset
the purpose of any business is to make money, especially when they get big, and have shareholders
But the level of personality and transparency and willingness to let their designers and engineers play in public gives me a fuzzy feeling about the company.
Of course it is
I didn't say otherwise at all.
thats just part of the marketing. Its noble, but its still just a mindfuck in the end. once a co. reaches a certain level, there's nothing personal about it anymore
/shrug
You can think what you want, you won't change my mind.
I fully embrace the fact that I'm a Google apologist.
It only works so far, just look at wal-mart. There are documentaries about how bad it is, but people still shop til they drop
I feel like Walmart is picked on a lot because it's so big
They don't screw people any more than other corporations, but they're an easy target.
I have nothing against google, especially since I dont pay them anything
Not saying what they (or anyone else) do is right, but I feel like a lot of the complaints are non-issues
Nah, walmart is seriously terrible. Not to say other companies are better, but the fact that they got so big is just going to put them more under the radar
Well, you may know other stuff, but the things I heard are fairly standard business practices and/or a logical progression of the capitalist model
So I have a hard time faulting them
I *do* fault them on the fact that their stores now suck complete ass and a great deal of their merchandise is, in fact, shit in disguise
I saw a doc on them, not exactly an objective source but it's bad.
If grocery stores didn't mark up their non-grocery items so much, I wouldn't shop their any more
well, other than to get my cereal, since Giant doesn't carry it >.<
as far as treating their employees. They also have a lot of shit for sale...cheap.
Yeah, I've heard a lot about their employees... but again, a lot of it seems pretty standard fare
Giant doesnt have cereal >.<
They don't have the cereal I want to buy
No
I dont really shop there, but I dont NOT shop there either
Right
The Walmarts down in Florida were awesome =(
And so were the grocery stores (<3 Publix)
Publix is actually a growing chain that is family- and employee-owned
Unfortunately situated entirely in the south
so was walmart :\
Walmart's trying too hard to mimic Target
I have a feeling it's going to turn into a Microsoft-Apple thing soon
Target will start surging ahead because Walmart's completely fucked everything up
Like decreased stock.
I used to go to Walmart because they had everything

Now their selection is worse than I find in my grocery store, the store design makes it impossible to find household stuff half the time, and when you do find it there are like 2-4 bad options to pick from.
So not impressed.
I have to go to a meeting.
